title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health
Interview Descriptions: Very standard but seemed that they really wanted employees. It's residency so imagine the standard match process. Program director was odd but nice. Program coordinator was amazing. Not too long or too short.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your strengths

title: Registered Nurse (BSN - RN) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health
Interview Descriptions: Smooth process and very friendly staff. The staff listened to me and gave me great insight!!! The HR manager took time out to follow up with me on multiple occasions and also answered all my questions in a timely manner!
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 3-5 years?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health
Interview Descriptions: Thorough interview process. Easy to find and clear expectations. I enjoyed it overall and would recommend to a friend. Thorough interview process. Easy to find. Clear expectations. Got to meet management.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and your goals

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom and then in person interview and shadow of the clinic. Went over expectations, job performance, benefits. Overall easy process to complete. Asked basic interview questions and allows for me to ask questions
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weakness.

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health
Interview Descriptions: Was brought in for multiple rounds of interviews.  Locations were changed multiple times last minutes. I remained extremely flexible and available. I was brought in to even meet the dietitians at one point. I ended up being rejected after a month of interviewing by a generic HR email. When I reached out regarding feedback on how I could improve I did not receive a response.
Interview Questions: Many were Medical Nutrition Therapy related or situational based.

title: Rehab Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University Health in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quick, impersonal, not as in depth however staff was friendly enough. Facility a bit old fashioned however clean enough there. Only one interview with 1 person and didn’t seem like they cared to know more than bare minimum.
Interview Questions: About experience and interest in the field

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Personality based questions. These interviews are standard, asking about your past experiences as it relates to the current job. Most of the interviews are asking for examples of your past that represent your work ethic, energy, attendance, quality, time management etc. The questions are looking for how your past experience has prepared you for the role you’re applying for and how you can achieve the responsibilities/duties.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a slow down and your last job or current job? - what did you do during that time?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health
Interview Descriptions: Quick, Fast, Easy. Took about 2 weeks and had a 30 mins interview with a 3 person panel from the department.  Heard back quickly and started right away. The interview was relaxed and everyone was very friendly.they asked more questions on my ethics of than my skills
Interview Questions: Do you believe people who do not have the means to pay for health care should receive  free benefits?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University Health
Interview Descriptions: You had to submit a Video interview.  It was well done and you had the opportunity to do it over if needed. After that they called you and you got an interview with a panel interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University Health
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and conversational. She described the position, gave only about 20 minutes or questions and "behavioral questions", then a brief tour of the facility. Was rather informal, sitting in chairs in her office. We also walked around the office and met some of the people working there.
Interview Questions:
Describe a time when you worked with an upset client.

Describe a time when you went "above and beyond" the call of duty.

title: QMHP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Both ladies were very professional. They knew the questions they needed to ask to make sure I would work well with the team. They knew exactly who they were looking for to fill this position.
Interview Questions: What about working the geriatrics?

title: Senior Employment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University Health in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: They first conducted a phone interview. Once they thought you'd be a good candidate, they would invite you for a second interview. The second interview consisted of the 2 supervisor. Supervisors would schedule another team interview, which only consisted of the team members. With the interview with the team it felt a bit disorganized and most questions were repeats from the first interview.
Interview Questions: What experience have you had with the mental health community

title: Telephone Operator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy . 3 interviews .... phone interview . Typing test . And interview with supervisors ... you receive a response early the very next day. Right after you accept offer letter you have to take tb test and drug test
Interview Questions: Why did i choose to apply at Truman

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health
Interview Descriptions: Everything moved relatively quickly, from the application to being contacted for an interview.  Standard interview questions.  Everyone I interacted with was friendly.  What I appreciated was the follow up, they let you know where you stand in the process, without significant delays between steps.
Interview Questions: Questions centered around experience, asking for specific examples.

title: Surgical Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very formal, easy and friendly. Came in and waited for director to be available. Did not wait long and went in to interview with director and another employee with experience. They were very friendly and made me feel welcome. They showed me around the unit.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process went smoothly as well as the interview. I felt comfortable and welcome from the moment I walked in and spoke with staff members. I also received a tour and a time frame as to when I would hear back from the company.
Interview Questions: How will you manage being a nurse? What is something you think you will struggle with as a nurse?

title: Employment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had one phone interview with a supervisor to see if I met the qualifications of job. Had face to face interview with supervisor and team manager. Had second face to face with the team
Interview Questions: How would your past work experience be useful in the position?

title: Parking Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Ask about customer service style and skills set.  How did you deal with unhappy clients.  Stressed that the client is king. Asked many questions about temperament, leadership style, and ease with using technology.
Interview Questions: How would you handle disgruntled employees who are upset with you adhering to parking policy.

title: Middle Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO)
Interview Descriptions: They generally interview based on your past work experiences to get an idea of how you handle difficult situations, how you work with other people, and if you are a good fit for the culture there.
Interview Questions: Asked me how I handled my most difficult work situation and what it was.

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy application. Quick response once application was submitted.  Interview was scheduled in a timely manner and received call within days after interview with offer. Relaxed interview with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have?

title: Mental Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview with both unit managers environment was semi-professional set up time to tour and shadow on the unit the next week for 4 hours on the shift that I was interviewing for
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Truman

title: Revenue Cycle Quality Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I met with the manager for the interview process in which she did not interview me at all. She did not have my resume out to ask any questions.
Interview Questions: The manager did not ask any questions until she was at the end of the summary of the job description

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I am uncertain of the hiring process. But the interview process was excellent. The interviewee wanted to assure that I would secure a position for which was a good fit, not just any position just to fill the opening.
Interview Questions:
Why work for TMC.
What makes you the best candidate for the job.
Why should TMC consider you as a candidate.
What are your strengths and weakness.

title: Emergency Room Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University Health in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process was easy. I had a phone interview with HR and then a in person interview with the ER Manager. It was very easy to talk to her and she seemed to really care about her unit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: PACU Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: They emailed me letting me know that they were interested in speaking with me. Met the recruiter for initial interview followed by meeting the CTM and DON for second interview the same day. It was very streamlined and organized.
Interview Questions: What did I want to do.

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: They ask a list of basic questions for a reception position. You show your knowledge with computers, phones, and fax/scanners. They were extremely friendly and patient if you let your nerves get the best of you.
Interview Questions: How many years have you used Microsoft Office in a professional setting?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: After my online application had been submitted I received a call from the unit director within three days to come and sit for an interview. I was interview by the director and was asked questions by her and other staff nurses that were working in the department that day. It was a low-stress interview that was professional and concise and was followed by a tour of the department and introductions to the doctors and team who also asked standard questions of me.
Interview Questions: They asked where I saw myself in 5 years and what I though my greatest strengths were. They asked if I had any questions about the position and what certifications and experience I had. The staff asked me all kinds of questions (ER nurses have no filter) then we had seemingly random conversation over platitudes and the job itself.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Called only a few days after applying online. Went in for an interview with HR and followed that with an interview on the unit. Had a unit tour and went home. Had a call later that day with an offer for the position.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult person you had to work with and what you did to overcome that.

title: Scheduling Support Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at a hiring fair.  I had a great rapport with the interviewer and she seemed to like my qualifications, but I was never given an offer or contacted again.  She definitely focused on my customer service background.
Interview Questions: Describe a time in which you felt like you could not help a customer at all.  What did you do?

title: ER Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO)
Interview Descriptions: One in person interview
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The recruiter saw my resume, so I received call from recruiter regarding my interest in the position. I was asked a couple questions about my comprehension of the job I applied for to insure it was something I was truly interested in. They invited me to come in and take a behavioral test (like a people skills test). I passed, so then the recruiter called to set up the interview with the hiring manager. I interviewed well, and received a call from the recruiter with job offer. They offered $1 less per hour than I wanted. I told them I was looking for a wage $1 more than they offered. They rebutted with a counter offer of the extra $1 I asked for, and then padded an extra 50 cents on top of that. I was pleased.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a difficult customer/co-worker you had to deal with, and how did you handle it?

title: Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions on the phone with the recruiter, then a face to face with the department director, and a person who would be a peer in that role. Everyone was really nice and easy going. I went in a suit and tie. I had a few questions for them about where they saw the team going and how they felt about the impact they had on the patients in the program this position was designed to support. Was definitely given proper expectations regarding how things would be in the role. Complete transparency about what I would be doing, and it was exactly as described by the director.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current position?

title: Senior Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Excellent and thorough hiring process with quick feedback. Very professional but user friendly as well.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a patient who came into the hospital and had two children at home that she could not care for while she was an inpatient here?

title: Clinical Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Once I turned in the application, it was a few days before I received what was basically a pre-interview screening with HR.  The person didn't know a lot about the role, so they asked basic behavioral interview questions.  Once I passed the screen, a second interview was setup with a team lead and members of the team.  In that interview, they asked more behavioral questions and then tested my knowledge of Cerner applications.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you struggled to balance client needs with company needs.

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: you go across the street to fill out application, or go online. Then you might get a callback or letter declining to consider you. The interview take 20-30 min., then if they are interested you have a second interview. If you are hired, you'll find out in a week or two.
Interview Questions: What health care setting experience do you have?

title: Clinical Nurse Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University Health (Kansas City, MO) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Brief, limited questions, comfortable, I felt welcomed
It was a quick process, the interviewer shared personal information about themselves
The interviewer did not appear prepared to conduct the interview
I was asked what I knew about TMC and their values
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work at TMC
